Acrodermatitis Enterohepatica occurs due to deficiency of?
exp: Ans. (c) Zinc. Ref: OP Ghai 8th ed./121. Autosomal recessive disorder caused by an inability to absorb sufficient zinc from the diet. Genetic defect is in the intestinal zinc specific transporter gene SLC39. A4. Clinical Manifestations# Vesiculo-bullous, eczematous, dry, scaly, or psoriasiform skin lesions symmetrically distributed in the peri-oral, and perineal areas and on the cheeks, knees, and elbows.# The hair often has a peculiar reddish tint# Ocular manifestations include photophobia, conjunctivitis, blepharitis, and corneal dystrophy# Chronic diarrhea, stomatitis, glossitis, nail dystrophy, growth retardation# Delayed wound healing# Lymphocyte function and free radical scavenging are impaired.
